revised_title: Nuclear Shell Model: Calculating Spectra with Cartesian Basis
tldr: The authors present a method for calculating matrix elements of a two-body interaction in wave functions classified by the group in the nuclear shell model. They introduce a Cartesian basis where all three components of the oscillator Hamiltonian are separately diagonal, simplifying the construction of wave functions and the projection of states from a single intrinsic function. This method is applied to the calculation of spectra for even-even nuclei in the mass region 1.
